dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model

Class Var

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.Any
      • dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.Var

  • public class Var
extends Any
    Variable specific functionality of Ctxt.

    Reading variables

    Variable nodes store a value. The type of that value is determined by the type of the variable. This class provides the functionality to access the standard variable types:
    • String
    • Bool
    • Int
    • Float
    For all these types the following functions are provided:

    • isString(), isBool(), isInt(), isFloat() to check if the node is of the respective variable type
    • getString(), getBool(), getInt(), getFloat() to access single value data
    • getStrings(), getBools(), getInts(), getFloats() to access list values
    If the variable has a fixed list of valid value this list can be acccessed via getRange(). The minimum and maximum allowed value can be accessed via {link #getKin}, getMax().

    Writing variables

    Via the methods in this class the values of variables or lists of variables can be changed. Like for reading the value of variables special methods for accessing Strings, Bools, Ints and Flloats are provided:
    • The setString(java.lang.String), setBool(boolean), setInt(long), setFloat(double) methods allow to change a single value.
    • The addStrings(java.lang.String[]), addBools(boolean[]), addInts(long[]), addFloats(double[]) methods allow to allow to add a list of variables to a list of variables.
    • The setStrings(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr.IMExpr, java.lang.String[]), setBools(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr.IMExpr, boolean[]), setInts(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr.IMExpr, long[]), setFloats(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr.IMExpr, double[]) allows to change the values of variables returned by an IMExpr.
    • addString(java.lang.String), addBool(boolean), addInt(long), addFloat(double) allows to add new variables to a list of variables with a given value
    • insertString(int, java.lang.String), insertBool(int, boolean), insertInt(int, long), insertFloat(int, double) allows to insert new variables to a list of variables at a specific position in the list with a given value.
    If the type of a variales is unknown the methods setValue(java.lang.String), addValues(java.lang.String[]) setValues(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr.IMExpr, java.lang.String[]), addValue(java.lang.String) and insertValue(int, java.lang.String) can be used.

    To reset a variable to its default value (or to add or insert a variable with default value) setValue(java.lang.String), addValue(java.lang.String) and insertValue(int, java.lang.String) can be used: 

     ctxt.var.setValue(null);
 ctxt.var.addValue(null);
 ctxt.var.insertValue(5, null);

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.a

        Fetches the type of a context node if the context node is a variable.
        Returns:
        The variable type of the context node or the variable type of the hosted node if the node is a list: UNKNOWN|STRING|INT|FLOAT|BOOL. UNKNOWN in case of an error
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • getVarType

        public int getVarType(java.lang.String path)
               throws CtxtException
        Fetches the type of a referenced node if the referenced node is a variable.
        Returns:
        The variable type of the referenced node or the variable type of the hosted node if the node is a list: UNKNOWN|STRING|INT|FLOAT|BOOL. UNKNOWN in case of an error
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • isString

        public boolean isString()
                 throws CtxtException
        Checks if the context node is a string.
        Returns:
        true if the context node is a variable of type String or a list hosting Strings. If no schema exist also variables of unknown types are counted as strings
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

        Get the boolean value of a variable at the named index if the referenced node is a ListDataNode. The method returns the value of the referenced node if the referenced node is a variable of type Bool.
        Parameters:
        idx - The index in the list counting from 1
        Returns:
        The boolean value of a list item at the named position of the context node if the list item is a Bool variable else false
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • nsAddBool

        public DCtxt nsAddBool(java.lang.String nodeType,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       boolean value)
                throws CtxtException
        Adds a new variable to the context node.
        Parameters:
        nodeType - The type of the node to add (may be null)
        name - The new name of the node (null if the current node is a list)
        value - The new value of the node (must NOT be null) - use nsAddValue to set default (false) value
        Returns:
        The DCtxt pointing to the created node
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

                       java.lang.String nodeType,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       boolean value)
                throws CtxtException
        Adds a new variable to the given node.
        To set a default value, the nsAddValue()-methods should be used
        Parameters:

        nodeType - The type of the node to add (may be null)
        name - The new name of the node (null if the current node is a list)
        value - The new value of the node (must NOT be null) - use nsAddValue to set default (false) value
        Returns:
        The DCtxt pointing to the created node
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

        public double[] getFloats(IMExpr expr)
                   throws CtxtException

        Returns:
        The values or null on error
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error

      • setFloats

        public boolean setFloats(IMExpr expr,
                         double[] values)
                  throws CtxtException
        Changes the values of a list of variables calculated via an IMExpr. If the nodes exceed the number of values the last value is used for all exceeding nodes. Non variable nodes are ignored.
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to evaluate
        values - The values to set
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • nsAddFloat

        public DCtxt nsAddFloat(java.lang.String nodeType,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        double value)
                 throws CtxtException
        Adds a new variable to the context node.
        To set a default value, the nsAddValue()-methods should be used
        Parameters:
        nodeType - The type of the node to add (may be null)
        name - The new name of the node (null if the current node is a list)
        value - The new value of the node (must NOT be null) - use nsAddValue to set default (-1.0) value
        Returns:
        The DCtxt pointing to the created node
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

        public java.lang.String getConfigClass()
                                throws CtxtException

        Possible return values are PublishedInformation, PreCompile, Link and PostBuild.
        Returns:
        the effective config class of the node or null
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error

      • isReadPermitted

        public boolean isReadPermitted()
                        throws CtxtException
        Checks if the value of the referenced node may be read from this context.

        Reading the value of a node can be prohibited due to the config class of the context. E.g. a code generator that is registered for config class PreCompile must not read any variables with later config classes (i.e. Link or PostBuild).
        Returns:
        true, if the node may be read from this context, false otherwise
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        13.0

      • isReadPermitted

        public boolean isReadPermitted(java.lang.String path)
                        throws CtxtException
        Checks if the value of the referenced node may be read from this context.

        Reading the value of a node can be prohibited due to the config class of the context. E.g. a code generator that is registered for config class PreCompile must not read any variables with later config classes (i.e. Link or PostBuild).
        Returns:
        true, if the node may be read from this context, false otherwise
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        13.0
